intro: Weinmannia weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's weinmannia, is a flowering plant species native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypress and related coniferous trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
